div.l: Yee can by Argumentis make a plase
A myle brode and xx foot of spase
Let se yff this spase may suffise
Or make it romer as ye can devise
Now symond seyd Iohn by seynt Cutbert
Ay is mery this is feir answerd
I have herd sey men shuld take of too thingis
Sclyke as he fyndis or sclyke as he bryngis
But specially I prey the hoost dere
Gete vs mete ⁊and drynk ⁊and make vs chere
And wee wol pay trewly at the full
With empty hondis men may no hawkis toll
Lo here our sylvir redy for to spende
The Miller to the town his douȝt̉ir send
For ale and brede and rostid hem agoos
And bond hir hors that they shuld no more go loos
And in his own Chambir he made a bedd
With shetis ⁊and chalons feir I spred
But fro his own bed ten foot or twelve
His douȝtir a bed al for hir selve
Riȝt in the same chambir by and by
It myȝt be no bettir cause why
Ther͗e was noon romer herburh in the plase
They sopyn ⁊and spekyn of solase
And drank evir strong ale of the best
Abowt mydnyȝt they wentto rest
Wele hath the Millere vernysshid his hede
Ful pale he wex for dronk ⁊and nat rede
He yoxith and spekith þurh þe nose
As he were on the quak or on the pose
To bed he goith and with hym his wyff
As eny Iay she was liȝt and Iolyff
So was hir Ioly wistill wele I wete
The cradill by hir͗e beddis feet she sete
To Rok and for to gyve the child sook
